items.sentence: It was fortunate for her that her husband arrived at that moment.
I appreciate your invitation, but I\'m afraid that I can\'t come.
When you have food allergies, eating out is difficult, isn\'t it?
Everyone thought that Tom was going to be in Boston this weekend.
Tom didn\'t know where to go to buy a ticket for Mary\'s concert.
Tom didn\'t want any of his friends to see his driver\'s license.
Tom didn\'t want to do anything that might hurt Mary\'s feelings.
Hey, if dinner isn\'t ready by seven, I\'m going to a restaurant.
I can\'t believe it\'s been more than a year since that happened.
I think it\'s time for me to talk to the boss about this problem.
I think it\'s unlikely that Tom will get back in time for supper.
I would\'ve read that book if Tom had told me it was interesting.
I\'d rather have it and not need it than need it and not have it.
If you don\'t have money with you today, you can pay me tomorrow.
What kind of music do you like to listen to when you\'re driving?
Apparently, Tom was already famous before he released that album.
It\'s hard for me to understand French when it\'s spoken quickly.
It\'s normal to feel nervous when you don\'t know what to expect.
Can you just tell me now, so I don\'t have to come back tomorrow?
Did Tom say he didn\'t think it was a bad idea for us to do that?
